Job Description: Chief Operating Officer (COO)

FinTech & Digital Banking, Vietnam & San Francisco Silicon Valley.


About VIETPAY - Where Innovation Meets Opportunity!

At VIETPAY, we are not just shaping the future of digital payments; we are crafting a culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence. We're on a mission to empower Vietnamese small businesses to be in charge of their finances. VIETPAY is headquartered in San Francisco with localized Vietnamese offices in Hanoi, Ho Chi Minh and Danang. VIETPAY has secured venture funding from USA based NEXXO VENTURES (San Francisco/Silicon Valley), and plans to IPO within the next 48 to 60 months.



Why VIETPAY?

Joining VIETPAY means being part of a dynamic team committed to transforming the small business digital finance landscape in Vietnam. We are seeking passionate, skilled, and visionary individuals to join us on this exciting journey.

  • Innovation at the Core: VIETPAY thrives on innovation. We invest in cutting-edge technologies and creative solutions to stay ahead in the fast-evolving FinTech landscape.
  • Collaborative Environment: We believe in the power of collaboration. At VIETPAY, your ideas matter, and your contributions shape the future. We foster a culture of teamwork where every voice is heard and valued.
  • Commitment to Excellence: Excellence is not just a goal; it's our standard. We challenge ourselves to deliver exceptional products and services, setting new benchmarks in the industry.
  • Compensation: We only hire the best of the best and we compensate our employees handsomely with generous salaries, achievement bonuses and stock options.
  • IPO: VIETPAY is USA Venture backed (NEXXO VENTURES /San Francisco/Silicon Valley). We plan to become the leading Fintech player in the Vietnamese market and plan to take VIETPAY IPO within the next 48 to 60 months.



Be Part of Silicon Valley Success Story, Join the VIETPAY Family:

At VIETPAY, you won't just find a job; you'll find a platform to showcase your skills, learn from the best, contribute to something meaningful, and partake in a Silicon Valley Success Story.

Ready to Shape the Future? Apply Now and Let's Redefine the Vietnamese Digital Finance Market Together!



Role Description:


Chief Operating Officer (COO); Location Hanoi, Vietnam.

We are seeking a dynamic and seasoned Chief Operating Officer (COO) to join our innovative FinTech company. As a key member of our leadership team, you will play a pivotal role in driving operational excellence, strategic growth, and overall success for VIETPAY. You will operate from our Hanoi Office; and you will be working closely with VIETPAY leadership in Vietnam as well as San Francisco. If you are a strategic thinker with a deep understanding of the financial technology landscape, we invite you to be a driving force in shaping the future of our organization.



Responsibilities:


  • Strategic Leadership:
  • Collaborate with the executive team to define and execute the company's strategic objectives and growth initiatives.
  • Provide visionary leadership in aligning operational strategies with the long-term goals of the FinTech organization.


  • Operational Excellence:
  • Oversee day-to-day operations, managing settlement and reconciliation activities with out bank partners to ensure ensuring efficiency, scalability, compliance, while adhering to regulatory requirements.
  • Develop, implement and optimize operational processes to support the delivery of high-quality financial technology solutions; enhance customer satisfaction and drive continuous improvement.


  • Customer Success:
  • Utilize customer feedback and data analytics to make informed decisions and improvements to ensure a positive client experience by maintaining high service standards and addressing client needs effectively.
  • Champion a customer-centric culture, supporting the success of customer onboarding and operations; as well as the implementations of automated and frictionless customer journeys.
  • Driving initiatives to enhance the overall customer experience in digital finance services.


  • Technology Integration:
  • Work closely with the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) to drive the integration of cutting-edge technologies and innovation into our products and services.
  • Drive the integration and utilization of cutting-edge technologies to enhance the company's FinTech solutions, capabilities and customer experience.


  • Risk Management:
  • Develop and implement risk management strategies to identify and mitigate potential risks, fraud, security breaches in order to safeguard the company against potential threats and ensure compliance with industry regulations.
  • Stay abreast of regulatory changes and ensure the company's compliance with financial and data security regulations.


  • Financial Management:
  • Work closely with the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to manage the financial performance of the company, including budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting.
  • Identify opportunities for cost optimization, revenue generation, and overall financial efficiency.


  • Process Improvement and Innovation:
  • Drive the development of new financial products and services, ensuring they align with market trends and customer needs.
  • Foster a culture of innovation within the organization, encouraging creative thinking and continuous improvement.


  • Collaboration and Communication:
  • Foster a collaborative and communicative environment across departments to ensure seamless operations and information flow.
  • Represent the bank in external relationships, including partnerships, regulatory discussions, and industry events.


  • Talent Management:
  • Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing operations team.
  • Attract top talent, foster a collaborative culture, and ensure the team is equipped with the skills needed for success in the FinTech industry.

Qualifications:

  • Fluent in Vietnamese and English is a Must-have requirement.
  • Proven experience in a senior leadership role within the FinTech and digital banking industry.
  • Strong understanding of digital banking technologies, trends, and regulatory requirements.
  • In-depth knowledge of financial technologies, market trends, and regulatory landscape.
  • Demonstrated success in strategic planning, execution skills, organizational development, and process optimization.
  • Advanced degree in business, finance, technology, or a related field.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.

If you are a results-driven leader with a passion for innovation in the FinTech space, we invite you to apply and be a driving force in shaping the future of financial technology at VIETPAY.

Position Status: Full-time

Position Level: 2

Reports To: Director/General Manager

Location: Binh Thuan Province, Vietnam


Job Description:

As a key member of the SIS Vietnam team, the Civil Engineer/Facilities Manager is an essential in the development of the facility. This position is responsible for the execution of all projects on time, in budget and scope, while making sure that all legal obligations/requirements are met to include, but not limited to, building codes, certificates, etc. It is important to achieve these objectives while ensuring the highest quality and best practices. Key role include focus on the costs, communication with all stakeholders and team members, and planning adequate and accurate lead times to ensure a smooth building process. The position is responsible for supervising all contractors associated with the project to ensure plans are implemented as directed by the executive team, meeting all agreed upon benchmarks, alignment with the goals of the company, contributing to the development with technical solutions and meticulous planning, while continuously reporting project updates to the Director/General Manager and Executive team. This position must prepare procurement specs, engage in detailed design, and establish robust execution schedules. This position will oversee and evaluate risk assessment plans and foster proactive measures for risk reduction. As the project progresses, all systems must be tested and deemed in excellent working condition and prepared for the work to be done at the facility. Once the building project is completed, this position will shift into start-up functions such as developing essential documents for the operation of facility equipment and systems for employees that will be utilizing to ensure a seamless transition. This position will maintain ongoing responsibility for the maintenance of the facility and proper condition of all facility operations so that the facility functions at 100% all the time, maintaining the care and quality of the live animals. With shrimp farming constantly changing and new technologies and methods arising each year, it is the Civil Engineer/Facilities Manager’s responsibility to recommend practical solutions and apply these changes as agreed on and approved by the Director/General Manger. This position requires the ability to prepare budgets for new capital projects, acting as the project manager for such projects from inception through design and completion, managing the startup and installation for new equipment, etc. This position is responsible for the flow and coordination of communication across all company resources needed to achieve optimal planning and functioning; and to achieve all organization goals and outcomes on an on-going basis, supporting recommendations with data that specifically details the value added to the company in relation to the costs.

Supervisory Duties:

This role directs staff and/or supervisors in the maintenance department. The role is responsible for the overall direction, coordination, and evaluation of direct reports and for carrying out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies and applicable laws. The Civil Engineer/Facilities Manager is expected to provide direct supervision, coaching, intervention and training to all direct reports in support of the staff and the overall organizational goals, mission and vision.

Essential Responsibilities and Duties during Facility Construction:

1.     Perform all duties accurately and according to SIS Procedures and Protocols.

2.     Develops in-depth knowledge of the contractual requirements for the project.

3.     Oversees the construction to ensure adherence to approved drawings and specifications; inspects construction workmanship, materials, and equipment.

4.     Oversees site work elements including water and sanity systems, site grading, concrete for vertical and horizontal construction, and architectural trades.

5.     Monitors the work process, performs quality assurance testing, and enforces safety requirements.

6.     Makes cost estimates on design changes, and evaluates cost proposals and contractors’ requests for adjustments.

7.     Reports to the Director/General Manager on the project’s conformity and non-conformity to approved drawings and specifications; make recommendations on how to correct deficiencies and resolve problems during construction.

8.     Maintains daily construction surveillance logs to ensure compliance with the terms and conditions of contracts.

9.     On behalf of the owners’ interest, the Civil Engineer/Facilities Manager will be responsible for overseeing the work of contractors over the course of the project. The Civil Engineer/Facilities Manager tracks the contractor scheduled milestones; materials, equipment, and labor used; the quality and workmanship of outputs, provides the contractors, observations, recommendations, and supervision.

10.  Monitors the construction schedule, reviews contractors’ proposals for change, and makes recommendations to Director/General Manager on time extension requests.

11.  Reviews contractors’ invoices related to civil/structural works to ensure accuracy and completeness. Works with Finance Manger to ensure invoices are approved and submitted for payment in a timely manner.

12.  Reviews and analyzes material samples, shop drawings, installation manuals, and other technical documents submitted by the contractors to ensure conformity with contract requirements.

13.  Prepares written reports to Director/General Manager with analysis and recommendations on alternatives and actions, where appropriate.

14.  Prepares periodic progress reports to Director/General Manager as required.

15.  Prepares and reviews engineering drawings, civil load calculations, technical specifications, and cost estimates for construction change orders or to support installed equipment.

16.  Makes cost estimates on design and specification alternatives as requested by Director/General Manager; must be able to present in two-dimensional and three-dimensional drafts to illustrate engineering problems and proposed solutions.

17.  Liaises with local authorities responsible for the implementation, scheduling, and compliance with local building codes and construction regulations.

Essential Responsibilities and Duties Post Construction of New Facility:

18.  Prepare and execute the departmental budget, review and monitor regularly and analyzes activities, costs, operations.

19.  Forecast data to determine departmental progress toward stated goals and objectives; provide written reports as required with data to support conclusions.

20.  Coordinates with Director/ General Manager and/or department managers to maintain/repair/upgrade facilities as recommended or needed to ensure that all systems are in optimal working condition at all times.

21.  Provide daily supervision to employees through training, monitoring performance, coaching, handling disciplinary issues, conducting performance reviews and delegating day to day activities and assignments.

22.  Maintain confidentiality of company proprietary information.

23.  Perform other duties as needed or directed by the Director/General Manager or designee.

Required Competencies:


1.     Analytical

2.     Job Knowledge

3.     Use of Technology

4.     Problem Solving

5.     Project Management

6.     Communication

7.     Cooperation

8.     Teamwork

9.     Change Management

10.  Performance Coaching

11.  Leadership, team and visionary

12.  Managing People

13.  Delegation

14.  Quality Management

15.  Conflict Resolution

16.  Impact and Influence

17.  Cost Consciousness

18.  Diversity

19.  Ethics

20.  Strategic Thinking

21.  Adaptability

22.  Achievement Focus

23.  Dependability

24.  Initiative

25.  Innovation

26.  Judgement

27.  Planning/Organizing

28.  Quality

29.  Quantity

30.  Safety and Security

Required Education and Experience:

1.     An engineering degree (civil or mechanical, with a priority on electrical knowledge and experience) from a reputable university in Vietnam.

2.     Minimum 2 years’ experience in managing construction projects, including managing budgets, workers and vendors.

3.     Fluent in speaking, reading and writing in English and Vietnamese.

4.     Ability to travel and be stationed in remote areas.

5.     Minimum 2 years management/supervisory experience.

Preferred Education and Experience:

1.     Educational training specifically related to aquaculture.

2.     Experiences in maintenance engineering.

Travel / Living Requirements:

1.     Occasional travel, local, national and/or international, may be expected with this position.

2.     Housing will be provided.

3.     Applicant must reside in the location of the position.

Physical Requirements:

1.     Ability to work at least 40 hours per week to include nights, weekends, holidays and/or on-call. Regular attendance is essential to carry out the duties of this position.

2.     Ability to lift or carry up to 50 lbs.

3.     Ability to work outdoors, doing physical work in hot temperatures, often on wet and/or uneven surfaces; and sitting/standing for long periods of time.

4.     Working conditions may also include getting into the tanks and working in wet conditions with the animals.

5.     Ability to work with chemicals such as bleach and acid, while following all safety guidelines.

6.     Ability to complete administrative related work such as project design, preparing cost estimates, etc.

Shrimp Improvement System offers a benefits package.

All interested candidates should send a cover letter, resume, and names and contact information for three professional references to ace@shrimpimprovement.com.sg. If you have a college degree, please include a copy of your transcripts.

Are you passionate about food, greenhouses and optimizing growth processes? Do you want to work with top-notch technology to provide clean and healthy food in a developing country? Do you want to work in an international company?


If so, we have an exciting internship opportunity for you. Join Royal HaskoningDHV Vietnam to contribute to the development of sustainable food production. You will have the opportunity to develop your research skills, gain expertise while contributing to a meaningful project. Take this chance and let’s enhance society together!


What will you do?


During a period of 4 months, you will prepare your research plan, collect data on a newly developed and constructed greenhouse in Long An (Vietnam) and write your research (probably Ho Chi Minh City). You will collaborate with our client’s team to gather data. You are expected to handle the investigation on your own, guided by the technical and horticultural expertise of our client’s team.


Your duties also include:


  • Harvest and record yield of individual plants;
  • Take camera images to assess growth of plants;
  • Use thermal camera images to assess plant stress;
  • Collect soil, air quality and other environmental data;
  • Analyse all data;
  • Record observation regarding plant growth or health;
  • Other tasks as reasonably assigned by your direct supervisors.


What you bring


  • Final year student in the field of ecology / biology / biotechnology or other related fields;
  • Be able to intern full time for at least 4 months;
  • Willingness to travel between sites and offices;
  • Experience with data gathering and field research, preferably in Greenhouses;
  • Experience with database management;
  • Passion for plants and agriculture, and ability to handle inclement weather including buggy conditions and hot and wet weather;
  • Fluent in both English and Vietnamese;
  • Curiosity to learn about international companies operating in Vietnam.


Where you will work


Active in Vietnam since 1985 and established in 1993, HaskoningDHV Vietnam is a 100% foreign invested company of Royal HaskoningDHV and recognized as one of the most prominent leading engineering and consultancy firms with a unique track record of key projects in Vietnam and SE Asia. With offices in Ho Chi Minh City and Hanoi and nearly 200 employees, HaskoningDHV Vietnam has carried out numerous projects for the private and public sector, comprising the full scope of engineering and consultancy services for Industrial projects, Maritime & Waterways, Water Management and Real Estate projects.


What do we offer?


We are a professional organization with appealing (inter)national projects and products. You will be working with experts who are leaders across different business lines. We also offer you:


  • Attractive allowance package;
  • Expenses paid for housing in Long An, travel to site from HCMC by public transportation;
  • Opportunities to join the transition to deliver clean food to a growing population;
  • Opportunities to discover the top-knowledge technology in the food producing industry;
  • Understanding horticulture: Learn about nutrient and environmental requirements, transplanting, diagnosing, and treating pests and diseases organically, and propagation;
  • Experience day-to-day operations in a fast-growing greenhouse start-up;
  • A unique experience to work with an international company.


This internship is open to VN students who is currently based in Vietnam.


Are you our new intern?


Are you interested? Then we would like to meet you! Apply now by sending in your English CV using the button below.
